FuncDef:
The set next-run-mode command sets a running mode for a specified chassis for next startup.
The undo set next-run-mode command restores the default running mode for a specified chassis for next startup.
By default, the running mode of a specified chassis for next startup is single-chassis.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a running mode for a chassis for next startup.
The value can be virtual-cluster-chassis.

Specifies the virtual cluster ID of a chassis for next startup.
The value is an integer.

Specifies a chassis, which is represented in the form of chassis type+chassis ID.
The chassis ID is 1 or 2. A chassis example is CLC1 or CLC2.

Examples: Warning: After setting the next startup mode, replace the configuration file and restart the device.
Please confirm,will you set clc1 next-run-mode virtual-cluster-chassis and cluster-id 1 ? [Y/N]:
Operation succeed,the clc1 next-run-mode is virtual-cluster-chassis cluster id 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When deploying a virtual cluster system, you must run the set next-run-mode command to set a running mode for a specified chassis for next startup.
Implementation Procedure
After the set next-run-mode command is run, the system prompts you whether to continue. Enter Y to continue. The configuration will take effect after the device restarts. Enter N to cancel the setting of the running mode.
Configuration Impact
If chassis-id is not specified, the running mode of the chassis on which the master main control board resides for next startup is configured.
Follow-up Procedure
Restart the device for the configuration to take effect.
Precautions
The virtual cluster feature is under license control.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
